item.title: Only stump of cycle lane batton remains, 17th September
item.description:
Bus knocked down cycle batton, cycle lane used for bus and parking. Only base of batton remains. Maybe consider a harder cycle lane barrier plus hard decision in middle of road to stop vehicles turning right going onto wrong side of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 235-239, High Road, Hornsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish, 17th September
item.description:
Rubbish. A constant issue close to the area of Bronze Age Way. Please delegate a clearance team to remove the litter & debris that perennially resides along this road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bronze Age Way, Lower Belvedere, London

item.title: An actual fridge kids could die in common, 17th September
item.description:
2 months of a actual fridge common it’s one thing that council tax in this country is the most expensive in the world, and that’s statically accurate, but worst the lack of care and humanity why would you let a fridge stand here for two months ?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Concorde Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet
